info.title: JinaD (Daemon)
info.description: REST interface for managing distributed Jina

get.description:
The instruction HTML when user visits `/` directly


.. #noqa: DAR201

get.summary: Get the status of the daemon

post.description: Create a Pea and add it to the store

get.summary: Get all accepted arguments of a Pea
Get status of a running Pea

delete.description: Terminate a running Pea and release its resources

post.description: Create a Pod and add it to the store

get.summary: Get all accepted arguments of a Pod
Get status of a running Pod

delete.description: Terminate a running Pod and release its resources

put.summary: Trigger a rolling update on this Pod

post.summary: Create a Flow from a YAML config

get.summary: Get all accepted arguments of a Flow
Get the status of a running Flow

put.summary: Run an update operation on the Flow object

delete.description: Terminate a running Flow and release its resources

post.description: Return a DaemonID to the workspace, which can be used later when create Pea/Pod/Flow

get.summary: Get the status of an existing Workspace

put.description: Return a DaemonID to the workspace, which can be used later when create Pea/Pod/Flow

name.title: Name
name.description:
The name of this object.

This will be used in the following places:
- how you refer to this object in Python/YAML/CLI
- visualization
- log message header
- ...

When not given, then the default naming strategy will apply.

workspace.title: Workspace
workspace.description: The working directory for any IO operations in this object. If not set, then derive from its parent `workspace`.

log_config.title: Log Config
log_config.description: The YAML config of the logger used in this object.

quiet.title: Quiet
quiet.description: If set, then no log will be emitted from this object.

quiet_error.title: Quiet Error
quiet_error.description: If set, then exception stack information will not be added to the log

zmq_identity.title: Zmq Identity
zmq_identity.description: The identity of a ZMQRuntime. It is used for unique socket identification towards other ZMQRuntimes.

port_ctrl.title: Port Ctrl
port_ctrl.description: The port for controlling the runtime, default a random port between [49152, 65535]

ctrl_with_ipc.title: Ctrl With Ipc
ctrl_with_ipc.description: If set, use ipc protocol for control socket

timeout_ctrl.title: Timeout Ctrl
timeout_ctrl.description: The timeout in milliseconds of the control request, -1 for waiting forever

ssh_server.title: Ssh Server
ssh_server.description: The SSH server through which the tunnel will be created, can actually be a fully specified `user@server:port` ssh url.

ssh_keyfile.title: Ssh Keyfile
ssh_keyfile.description: This specifies a key to be used in ssh login, default None. regular default ssh keys will be used without specifying this argument.

ssh_password.title: Ssh Password
ssh_password.description: The ssh password to the ssh server.

uses.title: Uses
uses.description:
The config of the executor, it could be one of the followings:
        * an Executor-level YAML file path (.yml, .yaml, .jaml)
        * a docker image (must start with `docker://`)
        * the string literal of a YAML config (must start with `!` or `jtype: `)
        * the string literal of a JSON config

        When use it under Python, one can use the following values additionally:
        - a Python dict that represents the config
        - a text file stream has `.read()` interface

override_with.title: Override With
override_with.description: Dictionary of keyword arguments that will override the default `with configuration` provided to the executor in `uses`

override_metas.title: Override Metas
override_metas.description: Dictionary of keyword arguments that will override the default `metas configuration` provided to the executor in `uses`

py_modules.title: Py Modules
py_modules.description:
The customized python modules need to be imported before loading the executor

Note, when importing multiple files and there is a dependency between them, then one has to write the dependencies in
reverse order. That is, if `__init__.py` depends on `A.py`, which again depends on `B.py`, then you need to write:

--py-modules __init__.py --py-modules B.py --py-modules A.py

port_in.title: Port In
port_in.description: The port for input data, default a random port between [49152, 65535]

port_out.title: Port Out
port_out.description: The port for output data, default a random port between [49152, 65535]

hosts_in_connect.title: Hosts In Connect
hosts_in_connect.description: The host address for input, by default it is 0.0.0.0

host_in.title: Host In
host_in.description: The host address for input, by default it is 0.0.0.0

host_out.title: Host Out
host_out.description: The host address for output, by default it is 0.0.0.0

socket_in.title: Socket In
socket_in.description: The socket type for input port

socket_out.title: Socket Out
socket_out.description: The socket type for output port

memory_hwm.title: Memory Hwm
memory_hwm.description: The memory high watermark of this pod in Gigabytes, pod will restart when this is reached. -1 means no restriction

on_error_strategy.title: On Error Strategy
on_error_strategy.description:
The skip strategy on exceptions.

- IGNORE: Ignore it, keep running all Executors in the sequel flow
- SKIP_HANDLE: Skip all Executors in the sequel, only `pre_hook` and `post_hook` are called
- THROW_EARLY: Immediately throw the exception, the sequel flow will not be running at all

Note, `IGNORE`, `SKIP_EXECUTOR` and `SKIP_HANDLE` do not guarantee the success execution in the sequel flow. If something
is wrong in the upstream, it is hard to carry this exception and moving forward without any side-effect.

num_part.title: Num Part
num_part.description: the number of messages expected from upstream, 0 and 1 means single part

dynamic_routing.title: Dynamic Routing
dynamic_routing.description: The Pod will setup the socket types of the HeadPea and TailPea depending on this argument.

dynamic_routing_out.title: Dynamic Routing Out
dynamic_routing_out.description: Tells if ZEDRuntime should respect routing graph for outgoing traffic.

dynamic_routing_in.title: Dynamic Routing In
dynamic_routing_in.description: Tells if ZEDRuntime should handle incoming traffic as dynamic routing.

entrypoint.title: Entrypoint
entrypoint.description: The entrypoint command overrides the ENTRYPOINT in Docker image. when not set then the Docker image ENTRYPOINT takes effective.

docker_kwargs.title: Docker Kwargs
docker_kwargs.description:
Dictionary of kwargs arguments that will be passed to Docker SDK when starting the docker '
container. 

More details can be found in the Docker SDK docs:  https://docker-py.readthedocs.io/en/stable/

pull_latest.title: Pull Latest
pull_latest.description: Pull the latest image before running

volumes.title: Volumes
volumes.description:
The path on the host to be mounted inside the container. 

Note, 
- If separated by `:`, then the first part will be considered as the local host path and the second part is the path in the container system. 
- If no split provided, then the basename of that directory will be mounted into container's root path, e.g. `--volumes="/user/test/my-workspace"` will be mounted into `/my-workspace` inside the container. 
- All volumes are mounted with read-write mode.

host.title: Host
host.description: The host address of the runtime, by default it is 0.0.0.0.

port_expose.title: Port Expose
port_expose.description: The port of the host exposed to the public

proxy.title: Proxy
proxy.description: If set, respect the http_proxy and https_proxy environment variables. otherwise, it will unset these proxy variables before start. gRPC seems to prefer no proxy

quiet_remote_logs.title: Quiet Remote Logs
quiet_remote_logs.description: Do not display the streaming of remote logs on local console

upload_files.title: Upload Files
upload_files.description:
The files on the host to be uploaded to the remote
workspace. This can be useful when your Pod has more
file dependencies beyond a single YAML file, e.g.
Python files, data files.

Note,
- currently only flatten structure is supported, which means if you upload `[./foo/a.py, ./foo/b.pp, ./bar/c.yml]`, then they will be put under the _same_ workspace on the remote, losing all hierarchies.
- by default, `--uses` YAML file is always uploaded.
- uploaded files are by default isolated across the runs. To ensure files are submitted to the same workspace across different runs, use `--workspace-id` to specify the workspace.

disable_remote.title: Disable Remote
disable_remote.description: If set, remote pea invocation is avoided. This is used by peas created by JinaD

daemon.title: Daemon
daemon.description: The Pea attempts to terminate all of its Runtime child processes/threads on existing. setting it to true basically tell the Pea do not wait on the Runtime when closing

runtime_backend.title: Runtime Backend
runtime_backend.description: The parallel backend of the runtime inside the Pea

runtime_cls.title: Runtime Cls
runtime_cls.description: The runtime class to run inside the Pea

timeout_ready.title: Timeout Ready
timeout_ready.description: The timeout in milliseconds of a Pea waits for the runtime to be ready, -1 for waiting forever

env.title: Env
env.description: The map of environment variables that are available inside runtime

expose_public.title: Expose Public
expose_public.description: If set, expose the public IP address to remote when necessary, by default it exposesprivate IP address, which only allows accessing under the same network/subnet. Important to set this to true when the Pea will receive input connections from remote Peas

pea_id.title: Pea Id
pea_id.description: defines the suffix for the workspace path of the pea`

pea_role.title: Pea Role
pea_role.description: The role of this Pea in a Pod

noblock_on_start.title: Noblock On Start
noblock_on_start.description: If set, starting a Pea/Pod does not block the thread/process. It then relies on `wait_start_success` at outer function for the postpone check.

runs_in_docker.title: Runs In Docker
runs_in_docker.description: Informs a Pea that runs in a container. Important to properly set networking information

timeout_ctrl.description: The timeout in milliseconds of the control request, -1 for waiting forever

ssh_server.description: The SSH server through which the tunnel will be created, can actually be a fully specified `user@server:port` ssh url.

ssh_keyfile.description: This specifies a key to be used in ssh login, default None. regular default ssh keys will be used without specifying this argument.

quiet_remote_logs.description: Do not display the streaming of remote logs on local console

The files on the host to be uploaded to the remote
workspace. This can be useful when your Pod has more
file dependencies beyond a single YAML file, e.g.
Python files, data files.

Note,
- currently only flatten structure is supported, which means if you upload `[./foo/a.py, ./foo/b.pp, ./bar/c.yml]`, then they will be put under the _same_ workspace on the remote, losing all hierarchies.
- by default, `--uses` YAML file is always uploaded.

disable_remote.title: Disable Remote
disable_remote.description: If set, remote pea invocation is avoided. This is used by peas created by JinaD

daemon.title: Daemon
daemon.description: The Pea attempts to terminate all of its Runtime child processes/threads on existing. setting it to true basically tell the Pea do not wait on the Runtime when closing

runtime_backend.title: Runtime Backend
runtime_backend.description: The parallel backend of the runtime inside the Pea

runtime_cls.title: Runtime Cls
runtime_cls.description: The runtime class to run inside the Pea

timeout_ready.title: Timeout Ready
timeout_ready.description: The timeout in milliseconds of a Pea waits for the runtime to be ready, -1 for waiting forever

env.title: Env
env.description: The map of environment variables that are available inside runtime

expose_public.title: Expose Public
expose_public.description: If set, expose the public IP address to remote when necessary, by default it exposesprivate IP address, which only allows accessing under the same network/subnet. Important to set this to true when the Pea will receive input connections from remote Peas

pea_id.title: Pea Id
pea_id.description: defines the suffix for the workspace path of the pea`

pea_role.title: Pea Role
pea_role.description: The role of this Pea in a Pod

noblock_on_start.title: Noblock On Start
noblock_on_start.description: If set, starting a Pea/Pod does not block the thread/process. It then relies on `wait_start_success` at outer function for the postpone check.

runs_in_docker.title: Runs In Docker
runs_in_docker.description: Informs a Pea that runs in a container. Important to properly set networking information

uses_before.title: Uses Before
uses_before.description: The executor attached after the Peas described by --uses, typically before sending to all parallels, accepted type follows `--uses`

uses_after.title: Uses After
uses_after.description: The executor attached after the Peas described by --uses, typically used for receiving from all parallels, accepted type follows `--uses`

parallel.title: Parallel
parallel.description: The number of parallel peas in the pod running at the same time, `port_in` and `port_out` will be set to random, and routers will be added automatically when necessary

replicas.title: Replicas
replicas.description: The number of replicas in the pod, `port_in` and `port_out` will be set to random, and routers will be added automatically when necessary

polling.title: Polling
polling.description:
The polling strategy of the Pod (when `parallel>1`)
- ANY: only one (whoever is idle) Pea polls the message
- ALL: all Peas poll the message (like a broadcast)

scheduling.title: Scheduling
scheduling.description: The strategy of scheduling workload among Peas

external.title: External
external.description: The Pod will be considered an external Pod that has been started independently from the Flow.This Pod will not be context managed by the Flow.

peas_hosts.title: Peas Hosts
peas_hosts.description:
The hosts of the peas when parallel greater than 1.
        Peas will be evenly distributed among the hosts. By default,
        peas are running on host provided by the argument ``host``

pod_role.title: Pod Role
pod_role.description: The role of this pod in the flow

RemoteWorkspaceState.title: RemoteWorkspaceState
RemoteWorkspaceState.description: Enum representing state of remote workspace created by JinaD

UpdateOperation.title: UpdateOperation
UpdateOperation.description:
Represents the type of operation to perform in the update
We consider these an `update` operation since they **change** the underlying state
